page.title: 18A 6TH FORM FOR CLEATOR MOOR
page.content:
The County Council Education Committee had given permission for a sixth form to be set up at Ehenside Comprehensive School in Cleator Moor but there was outrage when Sir Keith Joseph, the Secretary of State for Education refused to allow it, saying that it wasn't viable.
If children wish to take 'A' levels they have to transfer to Whitehaven School. They then have to get used to a new school and new teachers as well as study for the exams. If their parents transfer them earlier than at 16, Ehenside is left with an unbalanced range of ability and cannot be a true comprehensive. It would have given the school a tremendous boost to start their own sixth form courses.
It is planned to appeal.
